overview: From 2025-10-23 to 2025-10-24, elizaos/eliza had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topIssues.title: `Cannot find module '@anthropic-ai/claude-code'` after installing elizaOS CLI
topIssues.author: schmidsi
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I'm following the steps described here: https://docs.elizaos.ai/installation#cli-version-conflicts-mismatches

After running `elizaos --version`, I get an error message: `error: Cannot find module '@anthropic-ai/claude-code' from '/Users/schmidsi/.bun/install/global/node_modules/@elizaos/cli/dist/index.js'`

**To Reproduce**

1. Install the CLI globally: `bun install -g @elizaos/cli`
2. Verify installation: `elizaos --version`
3. Observe the error: `error: Cannot find module '@anthropic-ai/claude-code' from '/Users/schmidsi/.bun/install/global/node_modules/@elizaos/cli/dist/index.js'`

**Expected behavior**

The `elizaos --version` command should display the installed version number (e.g., `1.6.2`).

**Screenshots**
```
$ bun install -g @elizaos/cli
bun add v1.2.15 (df017990)
Saved lockfile

installed @elizaos/cli@1.6.2 with binaries:

elizaos

[53.00ms] done

$ elizaos --version
error: Cannot find module '@anthropic-ai/claude-code' from '/Users/schmidsi/.bun/install/global/node_modules/@elizaos/cli/dist/index.js'

Bun v1.2.15 (macOS arm64)
```

**Additional context**

- OS: macOS 15.6.1 (Build 24G90)
- Node version: v24.1.0
- Bun version: v1.3.1
- The `@anthropic-ai/claude-code` dependency appears to be missing from the package's transitive dependencies

topPRs.title: feat: create @elizaos/react package with headless React hooks
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Overview This PR introduces a new **** package containing headless, reusable React hooks extracted from the client package. This enables external developers to build custom UIs for ElizaOS agents while maintaining full type safety and React Query integration. ## What's New ### Package: A standalone package providing headless React hooks with: - âœ… Zero UI coupling (no toasts, navigation, or DOM dependencies) - âœ… Full TypeScript support with proper type declarations - âœ… TanStack React Query for caching and state management - âœ… Network-aware polling that adapts to connection quality - âœ… Composable lifecycle callbacks (onSuccess, onError, onMutate) ### Hooks Included (30 total) **Agents (8 hooks)** - `useAgents`, `useAgent`, `useStartAgent`, `useStopAgent` - `useAgentActions`, `useDeleteLog`, `useAgentPanels`, `useAgentsWithDetails` **Runs (2 hooks)** - `useAgentRuns`, `useAgentRunDetail` **Messaging (5 hooks)** - `useServers`, `useChannels`, `useChannelDetails`, `useChannelParticipants`, `useDeleteChannel` **Messages (3 hooks)** - `useChannelMessages` (stateful with pagination), `useDeleteChannelMessage`, `useClearChannelMessages` **Memories (6 hooks)** - `useAgentMemories`, `useDeleteMemory`, `useDeleteAllMemories`, `useUpdateMemory`, `useDeleteGroupMemory`, `useClearGroupChat` **Internal/Agent-Perspective (6 hooks)** - `useAgentInternalActions`, `useDeleteAgentInternalLog`, `useAgentInternalMemories` - `useDeleteAgentInternalMemory`, `useDeleteAllAgentInternalMemories`, `useUpdateAgentInternalMemory` ## Architecture ```tsx import { QueryClient, QueryClientProvider } from '@tanstack/react-query'; import { ElizaReactProvider, useAgents, useStartAgent } from '@elizaos/react'; const queryClient = new QueryClient(); function App() { return ( ); } function AgentList() { const { data: agents, isLoading } = useAgents(); const startAgent = useStartAgent({ onSuccess: () => toast.success('Agent started!'), }); if (isLoading) return
Loading...
; return (
{agents?.map((agent) => (

{agent.name}

))}
); } ``` ## Benefits 1. **Reusability**: External developers can build custom UIs using these hooks 2. **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript support with types from `@elizaos/api-client` 3. **Performance**: Smart polling adapts to network quality (2G â†’ 4G) 4. **Separation of Concerns**: UI logic stays in components, data logic in hooks 5. **Future-proof**: Ready for migration of `packages/client` to consume these hooks ## Testing - âœ… Package builds successfully with TypeScript declarations - âœ… All hooks properly typed with React Query v5 signatures - âœ… Zero build errors or type issues - âœ… Ready for integration into turbo build pipeline ## Next Steps (Future PRs) - Migrate `packages/client` to consume `@elizaos/react` - Add unit tests for hooks with mocked ElizaClient - Publish to npm for external consumption ## Files Changed - `packages/react/` - New package with provider, hooks, and documentation - Comprehensive README with installation, API reference, and examples --- **Ready for review!** ðŸš€ --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces a new `@elizaos/react` package with headless, type-safe React hooks and provider (plus build/docs), integrates it into the workspace, and publishes comprehensive core type declarations. > > - **New package `@elizaos/react`**: > - Headless React hooks and provider (`ElizaReactProvider`) built on `@tanstack/react-query` and `@elizaos/api-client`. > - Hooks for: agents, runs, messaging (servers/channels), messages (stateful + pagination), memories, and internal agent-perspective operations. > - Network-aware polling, composable mutation callbacks, TypeScript types, and index exports. > - Build tooling (`build.ts`, bunfig, tsconfigs), and comprehensive README. > - **Workspace integration**: > - Added to lockfile/workspace with peer/dev deps. > - **Type declarations**: > - Added/updated numerous `@elizaos/core` `.d.ts` and source maps to expose APIs/types for consumers. > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5a290e0071637d785858567d960ab7d1d5e54456. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).
